raw_affiliation_strings: Aysen Demirören (1959) received her Bachelor and Master Degrees of Electrical Engineering from Istanbul Technical University/Turkey in 1982 1985, respectively. From 1986 to 1993 she was a doctoral student at the institute of Science and Technology Intanbul Technical University. Her Ph.D. thesis was related to Adaptive Control of Synchronous Machine. From 1982 to 1996 she was an Assistant Professor at the Department of Electrical Engineering of the Istanbul Technical University. She has been Associate professor since 1996 at the same department. Her research interests are Power system control and modern control techniques, electrical energy generation, renewable energy sources. (Istanbul Technical University, Electrical-Electronics Engineering Faculty, Electrical Engineering Department. Maslak, 80626, Istanbul/Turkey, Phone: + 90 212 285 67 66.

affiliations.raw_affiliation_string: Aysen Demirören (1959) received her Bachelor and Master Degrees of Electrical Engineering from Istanbul Technical University/Turkey in 1982 1985, respectively. From 1986 to 1993 she was a doctoral student at the institute of Science and Technology Intanbul Technical University. Her Ph.D. thesis was related to Adaptive Control of Synchronous Machine. From 1982 to 1996 she was an Assistant Professor at the Department of Electrical Engineering of the Istanbul Technical University. She has been Associate professor since 1996 at the same department. Her research interests are Power system control and modern control techniques, electrical energy generation, renewable energy sources. (Istanbul Technical University, Electrical-Electronics Engineering Faculty, Electrical Engineering Department. Maslak, 80626, Istanbul/Turkey, Phone: + 90 212 285 67 66.

raw_affiliation_strings: H. Lale Zeynelgil (1959) received her Bachelor and Master Degrees of Electrical Engineering from Istanbul Technical University/Turkey in 1982 and 1985, respectively. From 1986 to 1994 she was a doctoral student at the Institute of Science and Technology, Instanbul Technical University. Her Ph.D. thesis was related to Transient Stability of Superconducting Synchronous Machine. She joined Electrical Eng. Dept. of Istanbul Technical University as research assistant in 1983, where she is now Lecturer. Her research interests include superconducting synchronous machines and superconductors in power systems. (Istanbul Technical University. Electrical-Electronics Engineering Faculty, Electrical Engineering Department, Maslak, 80626, Istanbul/Turkey, Phone: + 90 212 285 60 18,

raw_affiliation_strings: N. Serap Şengör (1962) received B.Sc., M. Sc. and Ph.D. degrees from Istanbul Technical University. Faculty of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Electronics and Communication Department, in 1985, 1988 and 1995, respectively. She joined the Istanbul Technical University as technical expert in 1986, where she is now Assistant Professor. She worked as visiting scientist at Circuit Theory Laboratory of Helsinki University of Technology in 2000–2001. Her research interests include nonlinear circuits and chaotic oscillators, artificial neural networks and continuous system design for integer optimization problems(Istanbul Technical University, Electrical-Electronics Engineering Faculty, Electronics and Communication Engineering Department, Maslak, 80626, Istanbul/Turkey, Phone: + 90 212 285 3619,
